Html:
I get an error when placing two seperate ZoomControls in one user control - is there a way to have two ZoomControls in one window?

Thanks,

Becky

Hi!

Please be a little bit more specific. What type of error message do you get?

Hi, thanks for the reply.

For example if I have a grid with two columns, and want a zoomcontrol in each column, I receive the error: EqualityToBooleanConverter: It's false, I won't bind back.

Not sure why it doesn't like the second zoom control but I was hoping for a way to have them side by side in a grid and then drag contents between them.

Thanks again,

Becky

I'm also getting the same error with trying to nest a pair of zoom's - one with the other.

did you find a work around/fix?

the stack for the exception is 153 calls deep so i'm not sure i can debug it!
